greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle which lists the bi-unitary divisors of n in row n.
comment: The bi-unitary divisors of n are the divisors of n such that the largest common unitary divisor of d and n/d is 1, indicated by A165430.
The first difference from the triangle A077609 is in row n=16.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..13171 (rows 1 <= n <= 2000).
maple: # Return set of unitary divisors of n.
# true if d is a bi-unitary divisor of n.
# Return set of bi-unitary divisors of n
mathematica: f[n_] := Select[Divisors[n], Function[d, CoprimeQ[d, n/d]]]; Table[Function[d, Union@ Flatten@ Select[Transpose@ {d, n/d}, Last@ Intersection[f@ #1, f@ #2] == 1 & @@ # &]]@ Select[Divisors@ n, # <= Floor@ Sqrt@ n &], {n, 35}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 07 2017 *)
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, May 05 2013
